Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery lekanis lid; interior glazed black; exterior: rays around knob; to the outside, black-figure decoration consisting of sphinx to right (head, chest and tip of wing missing; added red on hair, wing and body); incised blob rosettes as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.2155)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: UCL n 16 (Other Accession Number)
